snippet: Some 70 Bedouin families are likely to be evicted soon from their homes in Umm al-Hiran, the village in the Negev Desert where they have been living since the 1950s.
abstract: Israeli government is poised to evict Bedouin families from hamlet of Umm al-Hiran in Negev Desert, where they have been living since 1950s, in order to build Zionist Jewish settlement; government claims Bedouin community is on government land, but Bedouins say plan is based on discriminatory policy.

byline.contributor: Irit Pazner Garshowitz and Gabby Sobelman contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Some 70 Bedouin families are likely to be evicted soon from their homes in Umm al-Hiran, the village in the Negev Desert where they have been living since the 1950s.

headline.main: Village of Bedouins Faces Eviction as Israel Envisions a Village of Jews
headline.print_headline: Village of Bedouins Faces Eviction as Israel Envisions a Village of Jews

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Adalah, The Legal Center for Arab Minority Rights in Israel
